column5: Does anyone know of any camps that are offering special rates to attract fisherman to there camp next year? It sounds like a lot of camps were down and I didn't know if any of them were going to try something like that to get people back.
I see my outfitter raised his 2009 prices about 3 percent for 2009. I doubt prices will be lowered but heard some outfitters will keep 2009 prices same as 2008 prices.

I don't look for any prices coming down. They have to make a living also. I'm sure they would if they could in order to attrack more business but not at the expense of losing money. Just have to save a little here and there and hope the gas price keeps dropping.

I'm not allowed to discuss rates, but we will be running specials. However, you won't be able to ever find a special rate in the first two weeks of June. Most will be in July or August... or later. I would expects camps across the board to raise prices, especially for the popular weeks. (late may/early june)
Obabikon, I heard you have a special running the last week of September where you greet anyone arriving at your camp in a Crestliner with a cold beer. Is this true?
Last month anyone who arrived in a Crestliner was greeted by Otis who promptly marked the boat.
I'll just say watch out for Otis. He's the boss, and doesn't take well to riftraff off the lake! haha Beer's too expensive in Canada... hot cups of coffee!
